items.longDescription:
FUTURALABORATORIES

FUTURALABORATORIES is a design company and lifestyle brand created by the artist FUTURA2000 in 1997, as a spinoff group to the parent company at that time; PROJECTDRAGON. FUTURALABORATORIES has always worked closely with UMBRELLA FILMS for visual amplification and TARANTULA DESIGNS as a graphic think tank. The brand has created many collections over multiple decades and found numerous partners in various collaborative efforts. FUTURALABORATORIES was rebooted in 2019 with excitement and engagement across multiple platforms.

Dries quickly for a smooth, fresh feel all day long. Perfect for sports or casual wear.
- Featuring DRY-EX technology.
- With an iconic Futura print.
- A versatile item for sports or everyday wear.

Futura Laboratories LLC.
items.name: MEN FUTURA LABORATORIES DRY-EX Crew Neck Short Sleeve T-Shirt
items.shortDescription: Dries quickly for a smooth, fresh feel all day long. Perfect for sports or casual wear.

items.longDescription:
Jason Polan

Jason was an exceptionally talented artist and a genuinely kind person. He had the rare gift of making the most everyday things beautiful and interesting. It was an extension of the way he lived his life. This collection honors some of Jason’s favorite iconic drawings as well as shares new art from his Every Person In New York book. Please share in Jason’s incredible legacy with the Jason Polan UT Collection.

Jason Polan, originally from Michigan, lived in New York following college. His work is exhibited all over the world. He was the founding member of Taco Bell Drawing Club. Polan did projects with The New York Times, The Ford Foundation, The New Yorker and more. Polan continued to draw every person in New York until his death from cancer at age 37.

©Jason Polan
items.name: Jason Polan UT (Short Sleeve Graphic T-Shirt)
items.shortDescription: Jason Polan continuously drew cities and people. Many of his love filled works are now available from UT.

items.longDescription:

items.longDescription:
The National Art Center, Tokyo | Kashiwa Sato

Kashiwa Sato, one of Japan’s leading creative directors, has gained renown internationally with his innovative approaches to visual identity / corporate identity planning and brand strategies. The largest ever solo exhibition “KASHIWA SATO,” introducing the broad spectrum of his career over the past 30 years, is held from Feb 3 to May 10, 2021 at the National Art Center, Tokyo.

Keith Haring

A key figure in New York's East Village scene in the late 1970s and 80s, American artist Keith Haring's artwork populated not only art galleries, but also the city's subways, streets, and sidewalks. His work often combined an iconographic vocabulary, including hearts, flying saucers, winged figures, and a crawling "radiant baby", with abstract marks and patterning.

© Keith Haring Foundation. Licensed by Artestar, New York.
items.name: MEN Kashiwa Sato UT (Short Sleeve Graphic T-Shirt)
items.shortDescription: A UT collection by creative director Sato Kashiwa is here, full of his creativity and attention to detail.

items.longDescription:
PETER SAVILLE REMIX

Peter Saville is a graphic artist whose contribution to everyday life has been unique. As a founder and art director of the legendary record label ‘Factory,’ his pioneering artwork reached a mass audience through pop music and influenced the course of contemporary visual culture.

© Peter Saville and New Order
items.name: Peter Saville UT (Short Sleeve Graphic T-Shirt)
items.shortDescription: A collection showcasing the pioneering masterpieces of influential graphic artist Peter Saville.

items.longDescription:
EVANGELION

To celebrate the release of “Evangelion 3.0+1.0”, the fourth and final movie in the Evangelion movie series, UT is bringing a special collection which includes exclusive designs using animators’ drawing from the movie and special artwork. Check EVANGELION OFFICIAL for more information.

©khara
items.name: Evangelion UT (Short Sleeve Graphic T-Shirt)
items.shortDescription: Celebrating the release of latest Evangelion movie! Special collection featuring exclusive artworks.

GUNPLA 40th Anniversary

“Gunpla” are three-dimensional plastic models of items that appear in the “Mobile Suit Gundam” series, such as the mobile suit. A collection designed with popular motifs from “Gunpla,” which has sold more than 500 million units since its release in 1980.

©SOTSU·SUNRISE
items.name: GUNPLA 40th UT(Short Sleeve Graphic T-Shirt)
items.shortDescription: Commemorative Mobile Suit Gundam "Gunpla" 40th anniversary collection!

items.longDescription:
TEXT MESSAGES

Text Messages celebrates the work of artists who use language as a medium. Their text might pose a question, issue a challenge, or remind us to take action. We are excited to partner with these artists to bring their words to life.

About MoMA

The Museum of Modern Art in New York City is the world’s home for modern and contemporary art. Founded in 1929, MoMA was the first museum dedicated to new art and this bold, experimental vision continues to guide us today. We share the most thought-provoking and resonant works, from painting to performance, and are a place of creativity and inspiration for all.

Robert Indiana

Robert Indiana was an American artist, a pioneer of the Pop Art movement, who created a highly original body of work that explores the power of language, American identity and personal history. His image LOVE with its trademark tilted O is recognized globally as an influential piece of 20th Century Art.

© 2020 Morgan Art Foundation Ltd /
Artists Rights Society (ARS), NY
Project: 2020 by The Museum of Modern Art
items.name: Text Messages UT (Short Sleeve Graphic T-Shirt)
items.shortDescription: Bringing to life the works of artists who use language as medium.

- Made with tightly woven 100% cotton material in an oversized silhouette.
- Textured jersey material with a diagonal weave on the surface.
- The color is inspired by workwear and military garments that look great using pre-washed fabric.
- A collar in the same fabric as the body, tape behind the placket, a pocket on the left chest area, and an adjusted stitch count using thicker thread, for a more casual feel.
items.name: MEN Cotton Jersey Oversized Polo Shirt
items.shortDescription: A loose and casual piece, with an on-trend oversized silhouette that looks great.

items.longDescription:
TOKYO UT

A collaboration between UT and four Japanese artists active in Japan and overseas, centered on the keyword “TOKYO.” This collection expresses the individual sensibilities of artists Meguru Yamaguchi, Kosuke Kawamura, FACE Oka, and YOSHIROTTEN.

YOSHIROTTEN

YOSHIROTTEN is a graphic artist and art director, based in Tokyo. He works across a wide spectrum of fields, including graphics, moving images, 3D works, installations and music. In 2018, after holding solo shows in London and Berlin, he mounted a massive exhibition of his works, titled “FUTURE NATURE” in Tokyo.

©YOSHIROTTEN
items.name: Tokyo UT (Short Sleeve Graphic T-Shirt)
items.shortDescription: New “TOKYO” tees featuring designs from four up-and-coming Japanese artists

items.longDescription:
TOKYO UT

A collaboration between UT and four Japanese artists active in Japan and overseas, centered on the keyword “TOKYO.” This collection expresses the individual sensibilities of artists Meguru Yamaguchi, Kosuke Kawamura, FACE Oka, and YOSHIROTTEN.

Kosuke Kawamura

Graphic designer, art director, collage artist. In addition to providing artwork and graphics for apparel brands and advertisements, Kawamura is active in a wide range of activities such as creating fliers for music events, DVD / CD sleeves and book binding.

© Kosuke Kawamura
items.name: Tokyo UT (Short Sleeve Graphic T-Shirt)
items.shortDescription: New “TOKYO” tees featuring designs from four up-and-coming Japanese artists

MARVEL Essentials

The Super Heroes of the Marvel Universe are relatable and inspirational. Marvel has been creating numerous super heroes and their stories for over 80 years. Many of Marvel’s star characters were created during the Marvel Age of American Comics and have become pop culture icons beloved around the world by people ages and old.

©2021 MARVEL

items.shortDescription: Cool expression of the iconic motifs of Marvel heroes!

Mickey Motifs

Mickey Mouse has long been known for his iconic red shorts with two buttons, large yellow shoes, and white gloves. Then one day Mickey Mouse fell asleep and had a dream where his clothing came to life and began to move freely! This collection is inspired by a magical dream.

©Disney
items.name: Mickey Motifs UT(Short Sleeve Graphic T-Shirt)
items.shortDescription: In Mickey Mouse’s dream, his shoes and gloves start moving about freely! Introducing a fantasy-filled UT collection.

items.longDescription:
Musèe du Louvre: Art and Logic by PETER SAVILLE

Peter Saville is a legendary designer and art director for music and fashion. “I was inspired to discover thet the world's most famous work of art, the ‘Mona Lisa,’ is known at the Louvre simply as Painting No.779 － this is my theme for the Art and Logic collection.”

Aphrodite, known as the "Venus de Milo" / Hellenistic Art (C. 100 BC), Island of Melos (Cyclades, Greece)
© Musée du Louvre, Dist. RMN-Grand Palais / Anne Chauvet
© PETER SAVILLE
items.name: Louvre Museum UT (Short Sleeve Graphic T-Shirt)
items.shortDescription: A brilliant collaboration between the renowned graphic designer Peter Saville and the Louvre Museum.

items.name: MEN Waffle Crew Neck Short Sleeve T-Shirt
items.shortDescription: An evolved T-shirt that makes a casual statement all its own.

items.longDescription:
Roy Lichtenstein

Roy Lichtenstein was a forerunner and main figure in the pop art movement of the 1960’s. He established his vivid style by utilizing simple black outlines, bright primary colors found in ads and comics, and halftone dots used in newsprint. He is remembered fondly for depicting not only characters from comics, but also creating new works in his own style in dialogue with great historic artists like Picasso, Matisse, and Monet, among others.

© 2020 Estate of Roy Lichtenstein. All rights reserved.
Roy Lichtenstein™
items.name: MEN Roy Lichtenstein UT (Short Sleeve Graphic T-Shirt)
items.shortDescription: UT brings you the art of Roy Lichtenstein, icon of pop art.

Andy Warhol / Jean-Michel Basquiat / Keith Haring

Andy Warhol, Basquiat and Keith Herring laid the foundations of the pop art world. It is a collection using their popular masterpieces that still do not fade.

Andy Warhol

As the preeminent American artist of the 20th Century, Andy Warhol challenged the world to see art differently. This product is produced under a license from The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc., a New York not-for-profit corporation which promotes the visual arts.

©/®/™ The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc.

items.longDescription:
Andy Warhol / Jean-Michel Basquiat / Keith Haring

Andy Warhol, Basquiat and Keith Herring laid the foundations of the pop art world. It is a collection using their popular masterpieces that still do not fade.

Keith Haring

A key figure in New York’s East Village scene in the late 1970s and 80s, American artist Keith Haring’s artwork populated not only art galleries, but also the city’s subways, streets, and sidewalks. His work often combined an iconographic vocabulary, including hearts, flying saucers, winged figures, and a crawling “radiant baby,” with abstract marks and patterning.

© Keith Haring Foundation. Licensed by Artestar, New York.
items.name: Keith Haring UT(Short Sleeve Graphic T-Shirt)
items.shortDescription: Andy Warhol, Jean-Michel Basquiat, and Keith Haring's iconic works on UT.

items.longDescription:
Roy Lichtenstein

Roy Lichtenstein was a forerunner and main figure in the pop art movement of the 1960’s. He established his vivid style by utilizing simple black outlines, bright primary colors found in ads and comics, and halftone dots used in newsprint. He is remembered fondly for depicting not only characters from comics, but also creating new works in his own style in dialogue with great historic artists like Picasso, Matisse, and Monet, among others.

© 2020 Estate of Roy Lichtenstein. All rights reserved.
Roy Lichtenstein™
items.name: MEN Roy Lichtenstein UT (Short Sleeve Graphic T-Shirt)
items.shortDescription: UT brings you the art of Roy Lichtenstein, icon of pop art.

items.longDescription:
FUTURALABORATORIES

FUTURALABORATORIES is a design company and lifestyle brand created by the artist FUTURA2000 in 1997, as a spinoff group to the parent company at that time; PROJECTDRAGON. FUTURALABORATORIES has always worked closely with UMBRELLA FILMS for visual amplification and TARANTULA DESIGNS as a graphic think tank. The brand has created many collections over multiple decades and found numerous partners in various collaborative efforts. FUTURALABORATORIES was rebooted in 2019 with excitement and engagement across multiple platforms.

Groundbreaking DRY-EX material quickly dries sweat and moisture.

Futura Laboratories LLC.

items.longDescription:
Special collaboration with Jurassic World

© Universal City Studios LLC and Amblin Entertainment, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

This product is not from the collaboration with Hajime Sorayama.
We apologize for any confusing wording on some of the advertising materials and price tags.
items.name: MEN Jurassic World UT(Short Sleeve Graphic T-Shirt)
items.shortDescription: Special collaboration with Jurassic World

items.longDescription:
Jurassic World × HAJIME SORAYAMA

Explore the wonder and thrills of Jurassic World in an all new collaboration with Sorayama.
The collection includes Sorayama’s new work which is inspired by the Jurassic World franchise alongside Sorayama’s archival artworks.

Hajime Sorayama

Born in 1947 in Ehime prefecture, Japan. Armed with his astounding sense of realistic expressional techniques, Sorayama had developed his career since the early 1970s as an illustrator of pinups. His signature body of work titled, the “Sexy Robot” series (1978-) that integrates the aesthetic beauty of the female body into the context of the robot had come to present a significant influence on the subsequent formulation of robotic imagery. He also earned renown for his design work on the original Sony AIBO and for the album cover that he created for American rock band Aerosmith.

© Universal City Studios LLC and Amblin Entertainment, Inc. All Rights Reserved.
© Hajime Sorayama Courtesy of Nanzuka
items.name: MEN Jw X Sorayama UT(Short Sleeve Graphic T-Shirt)
items.shortDescription: A special collaboration between the "Jurassic World" and acclaimed Japanese artist Hajime Sorayama.
